verses.text_plain: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.verse_html:
1My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul. ▼
▼ weary…: or, cut off while I live

footnotes.body_text: ▼ weary…: or, cut off while I live
footnotes.body_html: ▼ weary…: or, cut off while I live

verses.text_plain: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.
verses.verse_html: 2I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.

verses.text_plain: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
verses.verse_html:
3Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked? ▼
▼ work: Heb. labour

tokens.text: unto thee that thou shouldest oppress

verses.text_plain: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?
verses.verse_html: 4Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?

verses.text_plain: Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man’s days,
verses.verse_html: 5Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man’s days,

verses.text_plain: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?
verses.verse_html: 6That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?

verses.text_plain: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.
verses.verse_html:
7Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand. ▼
▼ Thou…: Heb. It is upon thy knowledge

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Thou…: Heb. It is upon thy knowledge
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Thou…: Heb. It is upon thy knowledge

verses.text_plain: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
verses.verse_html:
8Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me. ▼
▼ have…: Heb. took pains about me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ have…: Heb. took pains about me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ have…: Heb. took pains about me

verses.text_plain: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
verses.verse_html: 9Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?

tokens.text: I beseech thee, that thou hast made

verses.text_plain: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
verses.verse_html: 10Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

tokens.text: Hast thou not poured me out

verses.text_plain: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
verses.verse_html:
11Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews. ▼
▼ fenced: Heb. hedged

verses.text_plain: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
verses.verse_html: 12Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

verses.text_plain: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.
verses.verse_html: 13And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.

verses.text_plain: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
verses.verse_html: 14If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.

tokens.text: me, and thou wilt not acquit

verses.text_plain: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;
verses.verse_html: 15If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;

verses.text_plain: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.
verses.verse_html: 16For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.

verses.text_plain: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
verses.verse_html:
17Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me. ▼
▼ witnesses: that is, plagues

footnotes.body_html: ▼ witnesses: that is, plagues

verses.text_plain: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!
verses.verse_html: 18Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

tokens.text: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth
Oh that I had given up the ghost

verses.text_plain: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
verses.verse_html: 19I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

tokens.text: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried

verses.text_plain: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
verses.verse_html: 20Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,

verses.text_plain: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;
verses.verse_html: 21Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

verses.text_plain: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
verses.verse_html: 22A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
